executive_summary: Engineering services revenue has grown at a CAGR of 1.6% to $350.9 billion over the past five years, expanding with its historical growth. However, the pandemic decreased demand across nearly all downstream markets in 2020. The economy's quick recovery contributed to substantial revenue increases in 2022. Despite ongoing challenges in specific needs, like nonresidential construction, revenue is expected to increase by 0.2% in 2024 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Heightened Uncertainty, Driven by High Inflation and Rising Interest Rates
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Inflation has risen, reaching a 40-year high in 2022. High inflation has resulted in increased raw material and labor costs, curtailing recent revenue growth. High inflation has roots in supply and demand factors, including supply shocks, money supply and consumer expectations drastically affected by the pandemic. The Federal Reserve has been raising interest rates, increasing borrowing costs and encouraging businesses to focus on cost-cutting measures instead of expansion.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Economic Volatility Amid the Pandemic Significantly Affected Major Markets
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Amid the pandemic, engineering services were indirectly impacted, as core businesses and organizations that are clients of engineering companies suffered through shifts in work patterns and slumping fiscal flexibility to take on new projects. A notable slump in the nonresidential construction market, particularly in 2020, was driven partly by more remote employees, with broader economic volatility influencing a significant cut in a core revenue channel.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Engineering Companies Implement Practices to Deliver Positive Social Impact
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Engineering companies have increasingly focused on developing sustainable technologies and infrastructure to bolster revenue and meet various social and environmental goals. Some examples of these developments include designing renewable energy systems, improving water and waste management systems and developing more efficient transportation systems. These advances have helped improve production efficiency, bolstering the shift toward sustainable systems within the broader engineering space and accelerating the development of newer, environmentally friendly technologies.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Economic Conditions Will Continue to Affect Engineers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Engineers' growth will be influenced by economic conditions, including US GDP, corporate profit and investor sentiments, since these metrics influence engineer demand and client capability to pursue projects. Anticipated growth in US GDP, coupled with a strong rebound in the private nonresidential construction market, is poised to stabilize core revenue channels moving forward, even though the Fed's current monetary policy presents particular short-term uncertainty.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: THE IMPORTANCE OF SUSTAINABILITY AND ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSIBILITY WILL INCREASE
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Sustainability and environmental responsibility are becoming increasingly important issues for businesses looking to meet their environmental obligations while improving client relations and production efficiency. There will be a greater focus among engineering companies on finding ways to reduce negative environmental impacts as awareness about human activity grows, mainly when dealing with environment-related projects.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: ENGINEERING COMPANIES WILL FOCUS MORE ON PROJECTS RELATED TO DIGITAL TECHNOLOGIES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: There will be increased demand for engineering services related to digital technologies, including the Internet of Things, artificial intelligence and 5G networks, driven partly by a shift in demand during the pandemic. These technologies will drive innovation and create new opportunities for engineering companies that have expertise in these technologies, particularly in metropolitan centers with a higher concentration of the tech sector.

industry_definition: Organizations in this industry apply the physical laws and principles of engineering in designing, developing and using machines, materials, instruments, structures, processes and systems. These services may involve providing advice, preparing feasibility studies, preparing plans and designs, providing technical services during construction or development, inspecting and evaluating engineering projects and providing other related services.
key_trends: Market share concentration varies by sector and niche. Each industry's dynamics significantly influence how concentrated the market is, affecting competition and business strategies.

Price differentiation in competitive tendering can force some engineering firms out of the market. Firms that can't compete on cost may struggle to survive, leading to reduced industry diversity and innovation.

Economic growth bolstered engineers' performance in the US. Many major sectors often use engineering services to enhance their efficiency and productivity, seeking to gain competitive advantages and streamline operations in a growing economy.
Economic uncertainty will continue to be a boon for engineers. High inflation has reduced demand for engineering services, as rising costs create uncertainty for investors in the industry.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Businesses include construction, architecture, engineering and others. Private enterprises account for most of this segment. During periods of economic growth, private businesses have more resources to invest in engineering projects.
The government segment includes federal, state and local governments. Government spending is often planned out and predictable, making it a stable source of revenue.
Other markets account for less than an estimated 1.0% of revenue and include nonprofit organizations and individuals.

products_and_services.product_description: This segment includes design services on industrial processes, equipment and product development.
Consulting services typically involve licensed professionals with relevant qualifications and expertise in specialized fields.
The segment includes services related to transportation, including mass transit systems, airports and highway and roadway projects.

tier_1_suppliers: Testing & Educational Support in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Design, Editing & Rendering Software Publishing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Industrial Building Construction in the US
Commercial Building Construction in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The value of private nonresidential construction includes expenditure on office buildings, hospitals, factories, power plants, communication lines and other structures.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast is the largest US region by population, creating a strong demand for engineering services.
The West, despite its smaller population share, boasts a high concentration of engineering firms.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Government Policies and Regulations Affect Project Mix and Costs
regulations_points.regulation_description: Government policies and regulations shape engineering services drastically by setting safety standards, environmental protocols and other guidelines.

basis_points.basis_description: Engineering firms often differentiate themselves through niche expertise, a collaborative approach, excellent customer service and a strong reputation.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Companies at the forefront of technological advancements or offering innovative engineering services may be able to differentiate themselves and increase market share.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase Costs Change Based on Changes in Input Prices
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: In 2024, purchase costs are anticipated to comprise 7.9% of revenue.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Engineering services primarily rely on skilled labor.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Engineering services are subject to the general state of the economy.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Companies develop new design techniques or methods.

FAQs.question: Do your company's sales depend on the overall health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Revenue for engineering firms will generally follow the general business cycle.
